Description: The Temptation of St Antony; the saint reading a book in a cave, wearing a cloak with a tau-cross on the left shoulder, a table with a sand-glass and a skull to the right, surrounded by demons and a bat above him, a snake in the foreground; after David Teniers the Younger Etching
Curator's comments: This is first state before reworking with the burin, for impressions of second state see S.4206; F,3.140 and 1868,0822.801.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (17.I)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
